document.heading: Paternity Proceedings Clarifying Amendment Act of 1978

history.narrative: Law 2-78, the “Paternity Proceedings Clarifying Amendment Act of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-232, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 21, 1978, and March 7, 1978, respectively. There being no action by the Mayor, it was assigned Act No. 2-172 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
